poem:
**The Year of the Audible**

In 2024, we turned our ears,  
to stories spoken, not just read.  
Voiceover waves replaced the page,  
as authors spilled from silver threads.  
  
The hush of paper sighs subsided,  
replaced by murmurs in our heads—  
a symphony of whispers crafted,  
binding us to woven words instead.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Listen up! Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
